greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of such divisors d of n that A048720(A065621(d),n/d) is equal to n.
comment: Equally, a(n) is number of such pairs of natural numbers t, u that A048720(t,u) = n and A065620(t)*u = n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences defined by congruent products between domains N and GF(2)[X]
Index entries for sequences related to polynomials in ring GF(2)[X]
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} [A048720(A065621(d),n/d) == n], where [ ] is the Iverson bracket.
program: A065620(n, c=1) = sum(i=0, logint(n+!n, 2), if(bittest(n, i), (-1)^c++<<i)); \\ From A065620
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 09 2019
